problem_text: I ride an 11-speed gravel bike with Shimano GRX. I want easier climbing gears without losing too much on flats.

why_it_fits: Shimano XT CS-M8000 gives a wider largest sprocket for easier climbing.
11-speed compatibility matches your GRX drivetrain and preserves shifting feel.
MTB-style wide-range retains high gears for flats while adding low gears.
CN-HG701 chain offers Shimano HG shifting and a quick-link for easy install.
suggested_workflow: Shift to smallest rear cog and remove the rear wheel.
Use the cassette remover + chain whip to remove the old cassette.
Clean freehub body, lightly grease splines, install new cassette and torque lockring.
Fit new chain to correct length with chain tool; join with the quick-link.
Use master-link pliers to secure the quick-link, remount wheel, and check derailleur indexing.
Test ride and fine-tune cable tension and B-screw for smooth shifts under load.
checklist: Adjustable wrench or compatible socket for cassette tool
